info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire and southeastern Columbia Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Housatonic, or near Great Barrington, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Sheffield, Austerlitz, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Stockbridge, New Marlborough, Monterey, Alford, East Sheffield, Hartsville, Mahkeenac Heights, Gomorrah, Newsboy Statue, Glendale, North Hillsdale, Williamsville, Alander and Southfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
